page.title: 03Energy.
page.content: Free miners rights were given by Edward 1 in return for help in undermining Berwick Castle and other Northern Strongholds.To qualfy you must be:Male,born in the hundred of St Briavels,and worked underground for a year and a day after the age of 21,and be registered in the books of the Deputy Gaveller (the crown representative) at his Coleford Office. A freeminer may dig a drift mine,a long sloping tunnel into a coal seam,to take out coal.The mine may be anywhere in the Forest area.Many people apply but do not get qualification. There is one driftmine in our area at Old Park map ref: 613/046 Jaime Cartwright.
